definitions: act of buying back something previously sold or securities by issuer
examples: The company announced a stock repurchase program worth billions
After the lease ended, she negotiated a repurchase of her car

definitions: general opinion held about someone or something based on past actions
examples: The lawyer's repute for honesty earned him many clients
A restaurant of high repute always maintains quality standards

definitions: something required as necessary or essential for a particular purpose
examples: Meeting the requisites for admission took several months of preparation
She gathered all the requisites before starting her art project

definitions: official order or formal written demand for something needed or required
examples: The department submitted a requisition for new computer equipment
Military requisitions during wartime often included food and vehicles

definitions: television program or movie shown again after its original presentation
examples: Summer television schedules are often filled with reruns
The popular sitcom rerun attracted millions of viewers again

definitions: act of selling something that has been bought or previously owned
examples: The resale value of luxury cars drops significantly over time
She runs a clothing resale shop downtown specializing in vintage

definitions: someone who saves another person from danger or difficult situation
examples: The rescuer pulled the child from the burning building safely
Mountain rescuers train extensively for dangerous climbing conditions

definitions: state of being alike or similar especially in appearance or nature
examples: The resemblance between the twins was absolutely remarkable to see
There's a strong resemblance between this painting and Monet's work

definitions: bitter indignation at having been treated unfairly or feeling of displeasure
examples: His resentment toward his former employer lasted for many years
Resentment can poison relationships if not addressed and resolved properly

definitions: member of military reserve forces available for active duty when needed
examples: The reservist was called to active duty during the crisis
Many reservists balance civilian careers with military service commitments

definitions: large natural or artificial lake used to store water supply
large supply or reserve of something accumulated over time
examples: The reservoir provides drinking water for the entire metropolitan area
The city built a new reservoir to combat recurring drought conditions
Her mind was a reservoir of historical facts and dates
The region sits atop a vast reservoir of natural gas

definitions: act of setting something back to its original state or position
examples: A factory reset will erase all data from your phone
The circuit breaker needs a reset after the power surge

definitions: process of moving people to live in a different place permanently
examples: The refugee resettlement program helped thousands find new homes safely
Urban resettlement schemes moved families from overcrowded city centers

definitions: act of reorganizing something especially positions or responsibilities within organization
examples: The cabinet reshuffle brought several new ministers into key positions
A management reshuffle often follows a company merger or acquisition

definitions: ongoing process of changing positions or arrangements within a system
examples: The constant reshuffling of staff created uncertainty in the department
Political reshuffling before elections is common in many democratic countries

definitions: period of specialized medical training in hospital after medical school
fact of living in a particular place for official purposes
examples: Her surgical residency at the hospital will last five years
The residency program accepts only the most qualified medical graduates
Proof of residency is required to register children for school
State residency affects your eligibility for in-state tuition rates

definitions: amount left over after the main part has been used or removed
examples: The residual effects of the medication lasted for several days
Residual income from investments provided a comfortable retirement lifestyle

definitions: small amount of something that remains after the main part is gone
examples: A sticky residue remained on the table after removing the tape
Chemical residue in the water made it unsafe for drinking

definitions: formal statement that someone is leaving a job or position
acceptance of something undesirable but inevitable with calm
examples: She submitted her resignation letter to the board of directors yesterday
The CEO's sudden resignation shocked investors and employees alike
He accepted his fate with quiet resignation and no complaints
There was an air of resignation among fans after another loss

definitions: capacity to recover quickly from difficulties or adapt to challenging circumstances
examples: Children often show remarkable resilience after traumatic experiences happen
The community's resilience helped them rebuild after the natural disaster

definitions: quality of being able to recover from or adjust to misfortune or change
examples: The team's resiliency was tested during their long losing streak
Building emotional resiliency helps people cope with life's inevitable challenges

definitions: sticky flammable substance from trees used in varnishes and adhesives
examples: Pine resin can be used to make natural waterproof coatings
The violin bow needs fresh resin to produce a clear sound

definitions: device that opposes flow of electric current in a circuit
examples: The circuit board contains several resistors to control current flow
A faulty resistor caused the electronic device to malfunction completely

definitions: act of finding a solution to a problem or dispute
examples: Resolving conflicts requires patience and good communication skills always
The committee is resolving issues raised during the public hearing

definitions: quality of sound being deep full and reverberating
quality of evoking response or having particular meaning
examples: The concert hall's acoustic resonance enhanced every musical note perfectly
The guitar's wooden body provides natural resonance for the strings
Her speech had deep resonance with the struggling working class families
The poem's themes found resonance across different cultural backgrounds

definitions: quality of being socially acceptable and having good reputation in society
examples: The family worked hard to maintain their respectability in the community
Victorian society placed enormous importance on appearance of respectability

definitions: process of inhaling and exhaling air for gas exchange in living organisms
examples: The doctor monitored the patient's respiration rate throughout the surgery
Plant respiration occurs differently during daytime and nighttime hours

definitions: device worn over mouth and nose to assist or filter breathing
examples: Workers must wear respirators when handling toxic chemical substances
The patient required a respirator to help with breathing difficulties

definitions: short period of rest or relief from something difficult or unpleasant
examples: The rain provided welcome respite from the scorching summer heat
Caregivers need regular respite to avoid burnout from constant demands

definitions: person who replies or reacts especially to emergencies or official duties
examples: First responders arrived at the accident scene within five minutes
The survey had over thousand responders from various demographic groups

definitions: act of stating something again often in different or clearer way
examples: The lawyer's restatement of the facts clarified the confusing timeline
A restatement of company policy was issued after employee complaints

definitions: person who owns and manages a restaurant as their business
examples: The famous restaurateur opened her fifth location downtown last month
Successful restaurateurs understand both cooking and business management equally well

definitions: act of returning something lost or stolen or compensating for injury
examples: The court ordered full restitution to be paid to fraud victims
Making restitution for past wrongs can help heal broken relationships

definitions: process of returning something to its original condition through repair or renovation
examples: The historic building's restoration took five years and millions of dollars
Habitat restoration helps endangered species recover their population numbers

definitions: something that helps restore health strength or well-being
examples: The spa offered various restorative treatments for stressed executives
A restorative yoga class helps relax both body and mind

definitions: person who repairs and brings back original condition of artworks or objects
examples: The art restorer carefully removed centuries of dirt from the painting
Furniture restorers specialize in bringing antique pieces back to life

definitions: quality of controlling emotions or actions through self-discipline
device or action that prevents movement or limits behavior
examples: She showed admirable restraint by not responding to the provocation
Financial restraint is necessary when living on a tight budget
The prisoner struggled against the restraints binding his wrists tightly
Safety restraints in vehicles save thousands of lives every year

definitions: room in public building with toilets and washbasins for public use
examples: The restroom is located at the end of the hallway
Most restaurants are required to provide restrooms for their customers

definitions: something that happens as a consequence or result of particular actions
examples: The resultant damage from the storm exceeded initial estimates significantly
Improved productivity was the resultant effect of new management policies

definitions: act of beginning again after a pause or interruption
examples: The resumption of peace talks brought hope to the region
Work resumption after the holiday break can be challenging for employees

definitions: renewal of strength or activity after period of decline or inactivity
examples: The city experienced an economic resurgence after years of decline
There's been a resurgence of interest in traditional crafts lately

definitions: act of rising from the dead or returning to life
revival or restoration of something dormant or declined
examples: Christians celebrate the resurrection of Jesus Christ on Easter Sunday
Many religions include beliefs about resurrection after death
The resurrection of the old theater brought culture back downtown
His career resurrection surprised everyone who had written him off

definitions: medical process of reviving someone from unconsciousness or apparent death
examples: The paramedics performed cardiopulmonary resuscitation for ten minutes straight
Quick resuscitation saved the drowning victim's life at the beach

definitions: business of selling goods directly to consumers in small quantities
examples: She studied retailing and merchandising at the business school
Online retailing has transformed how people shop for everyday items

definitions: fee paid in advance to secure professional services
dental device worn to keep teeth in position
examples: The lawyer required a substantial retainer before taking the case
Monthly retainer fees ensure the consultant remains available when needed
She wore her retainer every night after getting braces removed
The orthodontist adjusted his retainer to improve the fit
